identity.name: Alejandro Rubio
bio: I am a Computer Science Student at Texas Tech University who enjoys building AI systems and experimenting with low-level software.
Currently my focus is in Computer Vision, AI/ML, and Low-Level Systems Programming and have gathered a team of students to work on a startup, ZIATECHNICA and our Flagship Project A.R.A.

My career in C.S. thus far hasn't always been at T.T.U. No, in fact the earliest I can attribute the start to my path started in Eunice, New Mexico(2015) when visiting my brother in the summer where he made me learn HTML.

I continued to code here and there until my senior year at Lake Arthur High School(2020-2021), my hometown still in N.M. where I graduated and decided to study Computer Science at the New Mexico Military Institute (N.M.M.I.)

One and a half years later (Fall 2022) I graduated and transferred to T.T.U in the Spring of 2023 where unfortunately ~30 of my 65 credits transferred. That was a kick in the stomach but, it is here at T.T.U. that my appetite for C.S. has increased exponentially.
In the last several months I worked day/night and deepend my interests in Image Processing/Computer Vision systems and low level systems engineering for real-time behaviour analysis.
Despite my work/classes and my part time job taking up most of my time, I will pick up my guitar and melt people's faces of with my deathcore band Septilith.

I also spent time in Korea and Japan through Texas Tech University and CRCC Asia â€” experiences that broadened my perspective, inspired much of this portfolio, and deepened my interest in cross-cultural collaboration.
